Isesaki is a stop on the
, and is the terminating station on the

.

From Tokyo, Tobu trains depart from
Station. The fastest ride on Tobu is to take the all-reserved

limited express train, changing at Ota station to a local service for the run to Isesaki. With a good connection the trip takes approximately two hours and costs ¥2160. Taking regular Tobu commuter services decreases the fare to ¥1160, but increases the trip to approximately three hours and requires more station transfers.

Using JR, commuter trains from

station take approximately 2 1/2 hours at a cost of ¥2210. Take the JR Takasaki Line and change at Takasaki to the JR Ryomo Line. It is also possible to use the Joetsu or Nagano Shinkansen from Tokyo to Takasaki and then change to the Ryomo Line; this takes about 1 hour 50 minutes at a cost of ¥4900. JR trips are fully covered if you have a Japan Rail Pass or JR East Rail Pass.
JR Bus Kanto operates a daytime bus service from

, with multiple departures every day (2 hours, ¥1500).
